reviewText: The second part of this entertaining series shows us the life of the two former assassins for Inferno Zwei and Ein who now try to live as normal a life as they feel they can but the life there trying to leave also shows its head to try and return the two efficient operatives back to Inferno or remove them before they become an obstacle for Inferno as well as some in the inner circle who try to grab power.  Again if you've seen series like Noir or Madlax this series will feel a tad like the previous series though of course there are differences.  The series while not extreme in the blood or gore is dark so this series is not for young kids to watch,  the series animation and soundtrack fit extremely well especially during the dramatic scenes or the fight scenes.  The voice cast for both the English and Japanese actors/actresses did great in their character roles bringing out the emotional scenes very well,  the ending is ambiguous so you can read it as an ending or possible continuation of the series later on if the producers decide to it will really depend on your own personal feelings and thoughts on the subject.  The set is actually three dvds two which show the final episodes of the series and the third which has some trailers,  commentaries an the like but nothing greatly spectacular.  So if you like action series with lots of gunfights and battles here's a great one to get and if you already got the first part of this great series don't wait to long to finish your series set of this show....
summary: The Finale For Our Two Extraordinary Assassins Or Is It?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This one has it all...action, suspense, drama, romance, violence, great storyline, beautiful animation, likeable characters, excellent English dub, breathtaking musical score, (jeez, I'm outta breath...)These two assassins undergo many trails and tribulations over the course of a few years. Many tough decisions are made as they just try to survive and deal with who they are.I really don't want to give any of the story away (you can get the synopsis from the back of the box or from the description) but I've been waiting YEARS for more of "Phantom" (I bought the OVA back in 2003 and I LOVED IT).You may not be satisfied with the ending (it wasn't entirely clear) but that just leaves it open for more Phantom!!!
summary: One of this year's best series.
